faqs.question: Who is Dakota Fabro?
faqs.answer:
Dakota Fabro (they/them) is a full-stack developer, educator, and founder of Eleventh House Studios.

Their work lives at the intersection of technology, purpose, and reflection—building systems that are technically sound, intuitive, and meaningful.

faqs.question: What is their latest entrepreneurial project?
faqs.answer:
Eleventh House Studios is Dakota’s mobile app studio focused on products that foster self-reflection, interdependence, and human-centered engagement.

The studio’s ethos is simple: build tools that help people connect to themselves and each other, with accessible design and thoughtful engineering.

faqs.question: What did they do at their most recent role?
faqs.answer:
At Outright (https://weareoutright.com), Dakota architected backend systems with TypeScript and PostgreSQL, introduced CI/CD pipelines, and created collaborative spaces that strengthened the relationship between designers and engineers.

Highlights:

- Built asset libraries, debugging dashboards, and CMS customizations that reduced bottlenecks.
- Improved release reliability through CI/CD and better dev tooling.
- Facilitated cross-functional collaboration with structured, low-stakes co-working sessions.

faqs.question: What kinds of projects have they built?
faqs.answer:
Dakota’s portfolio spans community-first mobile apps, internal tooling for creative agencies, education platforms for LAUSD, public health resources, and business transformation sites.

Across projects, the throughline is the same: blend technical execution with accessibility, scalability, and thoughtful design. For specifics, try asking the chat about a project name to explore more.

faqs.question: What technologies do they work with?
faqs.answer:
Core tools and platforms:

- Frontend: React, Next.js, React Native
- Backend: Node.js, GraphQL, Firebase, PostgreSQL
- Languages: JavaScript/TypeScript, Haskell
- Integrations: OpenAI API and related AI tooling

Dakota believes tools can be learned; systems thinking and product-minded design guide the technical choices.

faqs.question: How do they approach learning, teaching, and mentorship?
faqs.answer:
Dakota’s background in education informs a clear, hands-on teaching style that meets learners where they are.

As a LinkedIn Learning instructor, they’ve guided thousands through complex engineering topics by breaking them into approachable, practical lessons with an emphasis on accessibility and inclusion.

faqs.question: What guides their work as an engineer?
faqs.answer:
Dakota is driven by purpose: software should serve real human needs and create space for reflection and growth.

Their approach draws on psychology, theology, and education—prioritizing equitable systems, intuitive UX, and technical rigor.

faqs.question: What is their educational background?
faqs.answer:
- BA in Psychology & Organizational Leadership — Azusa Pacific University
- MA in Theology, Ethics & Social Change — Claremont School of Theology
- MA in Education — Claremont Graduate University
- AS in Computer Science (in progress) — Citrus College

Dakota's interdisciplinary foundation supports a human-centered engineering practice.

faqs.question: How can I connect with them?
faqs.answer:
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/dakotafabro
Calendly: https://calendly.com/dakotafabrodev/30min

archive.question: What is Eleventh House Studios?
archive.answer:
Eleventh House Studios is Dakota’s mobile app studio focused on products that foster self-reflection, interdependence, and human-centered engagement.

Selected projects:

- Arcana — AI-powered astrology and tarot readings.
- Loop — Home and life care for shared households.
- Carabiner — A productivity tool designed with neurodivergent users in mind.

faqs.question: What is DakotAI?
faqs.answer: I’m DakotAI, a conversational guide built to share the story, projects, and philosophy of Dakota Fabro — a full-stack developer and educator who blends technology with purpose.

faqs.question: Who created you?
faqs.answer: I was created by Dakota Fabro. I exist to represent their work, values, and vision in an interactive, conversational way.

faqs.question: How do you connect to Eleventh House Studios?
faqs.answer: Eleventh House Studios is Dakota’s app studio focused on self-reflection and meaningful connection. I’m one of the ways Dakota experiments with building ecosystems that support inner growth.

faqs.question: What technologies does Dakota work with?
faqs.answer: Dakota codes with React, Next.js, React Native, TypeScript, and Firebase. They also work with Haskell and Python, especially for functional programming and AI-powered projects.

faqs.question: Has Dakota built projects with AI?
faqs.answer: Yes — Arcana.app is a standout. It combines tarot, astrology, and AI to offer reflective guidance in a calming mobile experience.

faqs.question: Does Dakota teach as well as code?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Dakota teaches LinkedIn Learning courses on Express APIs, Next.js CMS builds, AI in development workflows, and more. Thousands of learners worldwide have taken their classes.

faqs.question: What does 'purpose-driven builder' mean in Dakota’s work?
faqs.answer: It means Dakota designs software that doesn’t just work — it supports people in reflection, connection, and growth.

faqs.question: How do psychology and theology shape Dakota’s engineering?
faqs.answer: With their background in both, Dakota approaches software as a mirror: technology that can reveal patterns, encourage transformation, and deepen self-understanding.

faqs.question: Why is accessibility so important to Dakota?
faqs.answer: Dakota believes technology should reduce cognitive load and be inclusive for everyone, especially neurodivergent users.

faqs.question: How does astrology influence Dakota’s work?
faqs.answer: Astrology is one of Dakota’s personal reflection tools. It inspires them to design with cycles, alignment, and purpose — especially in apps like Arcana.

faqs.question: Can you give me an astrology reading?
faqs.answer: I don’t do readings myself, but Dakota’s Arcana app offers AI-powered tarot and astrology guidance.

faqs.question: What is Arcana.app?
faqs.answer: Arcana is Dakota’s mobile app for tarot and astrology guidance. It’s designed to feel more like a ritual than an app — calm, minimal, and reflective.

faqs.question: What’s the Arcana Engine?
faqs.answer: It’s Dakota’s in-progress Haskell backend for AI tarot interpretations, built with type-safe functional programming.

faqs.question: Has Dakota worked on other projects?
faqs.answer: Yes. Dakota has contributed to health resources (Get Answers PA), education frameworks (Cultivating Connections), and small-business transformations (Golden Bear Companies).

faqs.question: Where has Dakota worked?
faqs.answer: Dakota has been a full-stack developer at Outright Agency, a learning instructor with LinkedIn Learning, and founder of Eleventh House Studios.

faqs.question: What does Dakota teach on LinkedIn Learning?
faqs.answer: Courses on API architecture, Next.js CMS builds, AI in the dev lifecycle, and soon — building AI chatbots.

faqs.question: What are Dakota’s pronouns?
faqs.answer: Dakota uses they/them pronouns.

faqs.question: Where is Dakota based?
faqs.answer: Dakota is based in Pomona, California.

faqs.question: How can I connect with Dakota?
faqs.answer: You can reach Dakota at dakotafabrodev@gmail.com or on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/dakotafabro
